What are some of the steps and control procedures that ZED ltd can take to ensure proper accounting of all the transactions?

From the following information of EcoSan Trust, prepare relevant extracts of: a. Receipts and Payments Account for the financial year 2013-14 b. Income and Expenditure account for the financial year 2013-14
Ecosan Trust follows accrual basis of accounting.
â€¢ Grants received in financial year 2013-14 250 Cr. â€¢ Grants received in advance for financial year 2013-14 in financial year 2012-13 25 Cr â€¢ Loan taken 20 cr â€¢ Income from sale of furniture on 1-7-2013[book value on date of sale â€“ Rs. 2 Crores] 1.5 Cr â€¢ Rent received for premises owned 10 lakhs â€¢ Rent outstanding (to be received) for the premises owned as at 31st Mach 2014 5 lakhs â€¢ Balance on furniture account as at 31st march 2013 [depreciation provided at 10% on WDV basis] 15 Cr. â€¢ Invested in fixed deposits 15 cr â€¢ Programme expenditure paid 125 Cr â€¢ Salary paid (including salary paid in advance) 7.5 Cr â€¢ Salary paid in advance to staff 1.5 Cr â€¢ Repair and maintenance expenditure paid 2 cr â€¢ Repair and maintenance expenditure outstanding as at 31-3-2014 1 cr â€¢ Opening cash and bank balance 10 Cr

How can NGOs be different from each other (give explanations and examples where appropriate)? Can this diversity have an impact on the accounting policies followed? What differences can be noted in the accounting policies followed by a registered and an unregistered NGO? What would the differences in accounting be between an NGO working for urban sanitation in one city and an NGO working on education in numerous remote villages?

On checking the bank book of Well Life Society for June 2014 with the bank statements of the designated Foreign Contribution bank account no 63670009330 with SBI, the following differences were noted: - Bank Book showed a balance of Rs 2,22,593 as on 31st June 2014 - A cheque issued of Rs. 16,300 had been taken as Rs. 6300 by bank - A cheque for Rs 2,25,000 deposited into the designated Foreign Contribution bank account no 63670009330, had been debited by bank to the local bank account no 63670005155. - An amount of Rs. 2500 was received as interest on fixed deposit, directly into the bank account and no entry was passed in the books of Well life society. - Cheques amounting to Rs 25000 issued to Happy days suppliers on 1st may 2014, had not yet been presented to the bank - Cheques amounting to Rs 55000 received from courageous Trust, deposited in the bank, had not been credited by the bank - Bank had directly paid electricity bill of Rs. 3200 and no entry was made in the books of Well life society. - Bank charges of Rs 120 as per Bank statement had not been taken into the cash Book A. You are required to prepare a Bank reconciliation statement for the designated Foreign Contribution bank account no 63670009330 and arrive at the bank balance as at 31st June 2014 B. Also list out the actions that you would take as an accountant for each of the reconciliation items
